subject: Communication
title: Media Literacy as a Democratic Survival Skill
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Media Literacy as a Democratic Survival Skill.

hook.text: Finland ranks #1 in media literacy worldwide. It also ranks among the most resilient democracies. Coincidence? No.

buildup.text: Finland teaches media literacy from primary school: evaluating sources, recognizing manipulation, and understanding.

discovery.text: A media-literate population is harder to manipulate through propaganda, disinformation, and foreign influence.

twist.text: Most countries still treat media literacy as optional. In an era of information warfare, it's a national security issue.

climax.text: Democracy requires informed citizens. Information warfare targets that requirement.

punchline.text: Free speech without media literacy is a weapon aimed at itself.

quiz.question: Why does Finland's high media literacy matter for democracy?
options: A media-literate population is harder to manipulate
